ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Physics of planet formation and differentiation, phase change in earth systems, radiative forcing and climate

How to take a complicated problem and turn it into a toy model/back-of-the-envelop calculation. This course also opened me up to many areas in Earth and Planetary Physics, which was quite useful as I've never encountered most of the content before.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: interesting content, reasonable amount of work assigned well before deadlines, clear expectations, breaks halfway through the class
Dependent on the student: course was fully online, which helps with accessibility but can be challenging to learn
Weaknesses: changes to the syllabus without letting students know far ahead of time, each class would cover a lot of content

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Wasn't an easy course but learned a lot of techniques and topics that are very relevant to climate change and earth sciences
Yes, I recommend this course to all first year GAS students in EPS who are dealing with something physics/math related.
